widget.text:
Providing affordable top-shelf technical staff

to improve your business.

 

Our mission is to identify the top 2% of technical staff in the Philippines, and make them available to work directly for your business, in our facility, with our support. We recruit the best Engineers, IT support, Estimators, Draftsmen, Sales Support and more.

Tech Elite is a specialist information technology talent provider.

We work with you to identify the key skills, experience, attitude and cultural fit you require so that we can then source, test, interview and hire (for you exclusively) the best IT professionals who most closely match your requirement.

You will make the decision about whom you wish us to employ and how much you wish to pay.  The professionals you choose will work directly for you, under your management and control.  

And what’s best is that you can have all this for between 50 and 80 percent less than it would cost you to employ the same staff in Australia or New Zealand.

You might be asking how this is even possible. SEE MORE about how this works.

OR

CONTACT US NOW for a no pressure, FREE consultation.
MEET THE TEAM
WHAT WE DO
WE’RE COST EFFECTIVE

We Are Tech Elite

Nice to Meet You

Let’s connect and see if there’s chemistry!

We are Tech Elite

We Find You the Best IT Talent

We are a specialised IT talent provider to businesses in Australia and New Zealand.

We are Tech Elite

Something You Love

We provide you with dedicated IT professionals for between 50% and 80% LESS than what you would pay in Australia or New Zealand.

What We Do

A highly skilled, professional service.

 

Tech Elite is a specialist IT staffing facility based in the Philippines.  We supply full time Filipino IT talent for you - Australian and New Zealand technology businesses and technology departments.

Tech Elite provides anywhere between one, and up to 50 full time staff.  There are many JOB ROLES that we can recruit on your behalf.  We also assist you to grow your team over time.  Tech Elite also utilises industry-leading specialist IT recruitment processes to help you select the best IT talent to match your requirements.

You decide who is hired.  Tech Elite then employs the staff on your behalf.  This means you do not need to set up or operate a Philippine company or learn and manage the details of the Philippines’ labour laws. 

Wages are invoiced to you with no mark-up.  You decide on what salary and benefits to pay your staff and you manage salary and performance reviews directly with your Philippines-based team the same way you do in Australia or New Zealand.

Tech Elite provides everything else for a fixed fee per person per month.  OUR PRICING is less than you’d expect.  This includes office space, desk and chair, computer package, internet, power, HR (human resource) services, recruitment, payroll and salary management.

This model allows you to focus on managing your team and satisfying your clients, without worrying about premises, labour laws, corruption, and other challenges. 

Importantly, Tech Elite ONLY service IT businesses and IT departments, making us an expert in your business requirements.

You might be asking how this is even possible. SEE MORE about how this works.

OR

CONTACT US NOW for a no pressure, FREE consultation.

Want to KNOW MORE? Have the most common questions asked by our clients answered.

OR

CONTACT US NOW for a no pressure, FREE consultation.
- Robin Sharma
The change you resist is the growth you miss. Progress comes via the unexpected. Welcome it.

Rob has over 20 years experience in IT systems admin, tech support, project mgt. & implementation, training & team mgt. He also has 13 years experience in establishing and running IT services & training companies in both Australia & the Philippines.

Scott is an author and consultant on global resourcing for Australian and New Zealand businesses. He also has 15 years experience in running technology services businesses in Australia and over five years experience running Filipino technical teams.

Phil has over 25 years experience in running software development firms in Australia and Asia. With over 10 years experience in running and optimising IT teams in the Philippines Phil is also extremely knowledgeable with respect to team cultural differences and dynamics.

Arv has over 20 years experience in directing and implementing ICT projects across Asia and Australia. He has consulted to banks and telecommunications firms and has immensely broad project experience across both the hardware and software arenas.

A former golf pro, Brent has fifteen year experience with client services fulfillment in Australia. He earned his multi-shoring stripes running Filipino Facilities since 2013, and is our Director of Client Services since 2015.

The Tech Elite Team

Experience and passion combined gets the job done right ... the first time. 


Our management team are all Australian and we live and work in the Philippines.  We love the Philippines and it's people and out of all the places in the world to set up business, this is where we choose to be!

We also have strong ties to Australia and strive to provide the best advice and guidance to our Australian brothers and sisters and New Zealand cousins to enable their businesseses to compete on a national and international scale by providing easy access to an international resourcing model without the headache of setting up an operation abroad.
Need to know more?  CONNECT with us today!
- Robin Sharma
The bigger the dream the more important the team.

We’re Looking for You

A highly skilled IT professional looking for a better home.

 

Tech Elite is a specialist IT staffing facility based in the Philippines.  We hire people like you to help support our Australian and New Zealand technology businesses and technology departments.

The skills we recruit depend on the specific requirements of our clients.

 

Interested?  CONNECT with us today to investigate your options.
- Robin Sharma
The change you resist is the growth you miss. Progress comes via the unexpected. Welcome it.

Your Questions Answered

Knowledge is power.

 

Why should I consider employing offshore IT staff in the first place?

What IT job roles are suitable for offshoring?

What IT job roles can Tech Elite help recruit for me?

What are the benefits of employing my staff through Tech Elite versus other providers?

How does Tech Elite’s recruitment process work?

How much will the Tech Elite service cost me?

How long will it take for Tech Elite to find me the IT staff I need?

Where exactly will my staff be located?

What facilities does Tech Elite provide for my staff?

Can I visit my staff in the Philippines?

I don’t know anything about the Philippines or it’s culture.  Will this be a problem?

 

{{quote2}}

 

Why should I consider employing offshore IT staff in the first place?

There are a couple of key benefits related to employing offshoring as a viable strategy in your business.  In simple terms, offshoring can improve your service levels as well as lowering the overall cost to your business.  The theory is really quite simple …… you can employ the very top performing staff offshore for between 20% and 50% of an average performer in Australia or New Zealand.  The savings will of course depend on the specific role being analysed.  What we typically find is that roles with a lower skill requirement generally have a larger cost saving.  For more information we would suggest you purchase and read Scott Linden Jones’ book “The Third Wave”.

 

What IT job roles are suitable for offshoring?

There are probably a multitude of reasons why you should consider certain job roles within your oganisation as suitable candidates for offshoring.  Of course we recognise that some roles may not be suitable for offshoring, roles that by their very nature require an individual to be physically located “in-country”.  There are also other roles which we would not normally recommend for offshoring such as high-value business to business selling roles, and roles related to the “core operations” of your business.  People are the core of your business and these roles are what make your business uniquely you.  However, job roles which are either administrative in nature, well documented or are highly process oriented are great candidates for offshoring.  Also, some customer service roles utilising both telephone, chat and email services are also potentially good candidates for offshoring.  Even certain components of the job roles that you are not able to offshore are also possible candidates for offshoring.  See our list of recommended JOB ROLES for more guidance.

 

What IT job roles can Tech Elite help recruit for me?

There are a range of different IT-focused roles that we would recommend for offshoring.  See our comprehensive list of typical JOB ROLES that we recruit on behalf of clients like you. 

 

What are the benefits of employing my staff through Tech Elite versus other providers?

There are very few providers in the Philippines who focus on recruiting IT Talent ONLY.  Tech Elite is one of those.  Also, our Senior Management TEAM has an average of 22 years experience in the IT industry both in Australia and internationally.  Two of our Philippine-based managers each have an average of 9 years experience successfully building Philippine-based businesses and recruiting and managing Filipino resources.  Therefore we are able to better understand your challenges, help you identify the roles where offshoring will produce the highest value return for your business and provide you advice and guidance with respect to your new resourcing model.  Finally, our recruitment methods are what sets us apart and provides you with top shelf staff, every time.  Our recruitment team leverages experts in the specific IT discipline you wish to hire – effectively we have a range of highly talented IT people assessing the skills of your candidates.

 

How does Tech Elite’s recruitment process work?

Having been involved in hiring technical staff before, you know that neither resume content nor the number of years experience will prove the quality of an employee.  You have probably hired staff before that look great on paper but who turn out to be poorly skilled.

Our recruitment process is one of the most rigorous anywhere in the world – not even specialist recruitment firms go to the extent that we do to ensure technical skills, soft skills, and attitude are a great match.

Our recruitment process includes the following stages:

  1. Position Build – Ensuring we understand what you need.
  2. Find Candidates – We use a combination of broadcasting and head-hunting.
  3. Self Assessment – What do candidates believe they are great at?  What is important to each?
  4. Resume Filtering – What experience / skills do they SAY they have?
  5. Primary Technical Testing – What skills do they ACTUALLY have?
  6. English Testing – Do they have the written / conversational skills to meet your needs?
  7. Secondary Technical Testing – Some positions require further vetting of a candidate’s skills.
  8. Psychometric Profiling – Our exclusive profiling system digs much deeper.  What is this person actually LIKE for your team to work with?  How will they perform when they are under pressure?  What are their weakest areas. (we all have them!)  What management techniques will be needed to ensure the best results?
  9. Client Interview – By this stage we are already confident that they can do the job, this interview is just to ensure that you like them and they will fit into your company culture.

 

How much will the Tech Elite service cost me?

The cost of Tech Elite’s service is very competitive.  We are not the cheapest in the market but we believe in the quality and effectiveness of our recruiting processes and testing procedures to deliver the highest quality IT talent for your team.  As explained in the SERVICES section of our website, in addition to the salary package that you negotiate with your selected staff, our fee per seat depends on the number of staff you decide to hire.  The more staff you hire, the cheaper your per seat fee becomes. COSTS are invoiced to you monthly in advance.  With our transparent pricing in place, you always know where you stand.

 

How long will it take for Tech Elite to find me the IT staff I need?

This all depends on the role we are recruiting on your behalf.  It really comes down to two key determinants …. the law of supply and demand, and .... the details of the package on offer.  If the supply of talent for a particular job role is high with less demand and your package is very competitive as compared to the local job market rates, then you could reasonably expect someone to be starting with your team anywhere between six and eight weeks from the time we commence our recruitment activities.  At the other end of the spectrum, if the role is a highly skilled role with significant or more specialised experience requirements then it could be three to four months before your new staff are ready to join your team.  The slightly longer timeframes to recruit your team are based on the fact that we only consider presenting you with the top candidates for your consideration.  These candidates are usually already employed (some of them happily) and the available pool of talent matching our strict criteria is only a small proportion of the larger pool of the talent in the market.  As they say quality takes time.

 

Where exactly will my staff be located?

Tech Elite’s offices are located in Clark, Pampanga, Philippines.  This is around 2 hours drive north from Metro Manila.  We located our offices in Clark in order to provide your staff with the least stressful, most productive working environment available in the Philippines today.  Clark is clear of traffic, chaos, crowds, pollution and flooding which are daily concerns for businesses located in Metro Manila.  In Clark, commute times, even from the nearby cities of Mabalacat or Angeles are no more than 15 minutes by private transport or 30 minutes by public transport.  Average commute times in Metro Manila range between two hours and up to six hours per day.  Commute times of this length (in overcrowded, non air conditioned public transport), and always in hot and humid conditions do not lead to productive staff when they arrive at their offices.  We offer a peaceful working environment that encourages our staff to become the best IT professional they can be.  Less time commuting means staff are more focused and productive when they are in the office and this also allows them to spend more time with family and friends.  Happier staff are more productive people.

 

What facilities does Tech Elite provide for my staff?

Tech Elite provides your new staff with first class facilities and whatever tools they need in order to deliver a high quality result to your business.  The standard package provided to all staff when they start with Tech Elite is a larger than industry-standard office desk with a high quality office chair.  Some centers we’ve visited pack in their staff like “battery chickens” and still expect top performances from their team.  We know that if we are to attract the best IT talent in the market, then their work environment needs to be comfortable and health sensitive.  Your staff need sufficient space and comfort to be able to perform at their peak and work in an environment conducive to being able to produce the best results for you, our clients.  We also provide standard, a quality computer package consisting of a mid to high-end laptop and a 22 inch external monitor.  Should you require additional processing power, bigger or higher resolution monitors or any other additional tools for your staff, Tech Elite can source and provision this for your staff “at cost”.

Our facility is also connected to a high speed, fiber-based internet service which is one of the fastest, most reliable services available in the Philippines today.  In the case of the very rare instance of an internet service outage with our fiber connection, we also have a backup internet service available.

Finally, should there be any interruption to the supply of electricity to our offices, we have commissioned a large backup diesel generator which automatically cuts in to supply power to our entire facility.

 

Can I visit my staff in the Philippines?

You can arrange to meet your team in the Philippines at any time.  Manila is a direct nine-hour flight from Sydney or Melbourne.   So depending on your location in Australia or New Zealand you would just need to add your time to travel to either of these two cities and any additional transit time.  

The preferred alternative would be to fly to Singapore or Hong Kong first and then to take a connecting flight direct to Clark.  This would avoid the traffic, congestion, pollution, chaos and stress of arranging ground transport and traveling from Manila to Clark.  This is not something that you would find very enjoyable after a long flight.

Tech Elite can help advise you on your travel arrangements based on your preferred itinerary.

 

I don’t know anything about the Philippines or it’s culture.  Will this be a problem?

Although your team will be fluent in English and their communication skills are excellent, there are quite a few differences between the Australian and New Zealand culture and the culture of the Philippines that you will need to be aware of in order to get the best from your team.  However, you have no need to worry as Tech Elite provides you with a Cultural Alignment Briefing to assist you and your local team and managers to understand and integrate more easily with your Filipino team.
- Robin Sharma
The right question inevitably leads you to the correct answer. Ask the right questions.
- Robin Sharma
Staying stuck in your past is stealing from your future.

- Robin Sharma
The marketplace rewards mastery. People always pay for the best.

Networks 

Network Administrator

Supports and maintains network infrastructure such as switches, routers and firewalls.

Salary Range: AU $16,000 - AU $24,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

 

Network Engineer

Designs and implements network infrastructure.

Salary Range: AU $16,000 - AU $24,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Server and Storage

Systems Administrator

These are technical roles that specialise in just a few technologies or operating systems. It is common for a systems administrator to have experience with a number of different technologies that are provided by the same vendor. For example, a Windows systems administrator with Microsoft Exchange server skills. 

Salary Range: AU $17,000 - AU $25,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Server Administrator

Installs, configures, supports and maintains server infrastructure and server operating systems. 

Salary Range: AU $12,000 - AU $24,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Windows Desktop Engineer

Plans, designs, configures, installs, maintains and troubleshoots Windows systems.

Salary Range: AU $10,000 - AU $16,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Database 

Database Administrator (DBA)

Ensures the proper operation of business systems software concerned with the storage and processing of large quantities of data. Some widely used database software platforms include Oracle, Microsoft SQLServer and MySQL.

Salary Range: AU $20,000 - AU $30,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Security

Security Administrator

Security roles vary in scope and skills. Some security roles are tied closely with vendor firewall software, patch management, virus scanners or IPS / IDS while other security roles are policy based and do not have a specific technical requirement associated with the role.

Salary Range: AU $16,000 - AU $24,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Help Desk / Service Desk 

Help Desk Engineer (Level 1 - Level 2)

This role is the first line of assistance for all IT related queries from business users.

Salary Range: AU $10,000 - AU $17,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Help Desk Team Leader

Monitors, motivates and manages service desk team members.

Salary Range: AU $18,000 - AU $24,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Computer Support

Desktop Support (Level 1 - Level 3)

Responsible for the upkeep of desktop operating systems and common applications.

Salary Range: AU $10,000 - AU $17,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

General IT Support Engineer

Maintains IT systems such as computers, mobile devices, LAN, WAN and applications.

Salary Range: AU $15,000 - AU $22,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Sales 

Sales related IT roles require a high-level understanding of IT systems as well as excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

IT Sales Support

Is responsible for researching and configuring IT hardware and software solutions and compiling sales quotes. 

Salary Range: AU $13,000 - AU $17,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Lead Generation

List building for possible future clients.  Initial calls and email is sent to potential clients to offer to send them information or book a meeting.

Salary Range: AU $10,000 - AU $12,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Senior Developer / Team Leader

The leader of your offshore development team must have the right background, experience and be thoroughly tested for skills.  This is one of the most sought-after skillsets in the Philippines, so wages are around one third of Australian rates instead of the usual one fifth.

Salary Range: AU $32,000 - AU $59,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

 

Software Developer - Mid Level

Developer talent is available acrosss a range of development platforms.

Salary Range: AU $19,000 - AU $32,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

Software Developer - iOS / Android

There is a large amount of market demand for iOS / Android developers, so availability can vary.  Those with 1 to 2 years experience with iOS are easier to find than those with 3 or more years of significant exprience.

Salary Range: AU $25,000 - AU $32,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).

 

Graphic Design - User Interface / User Experience (UI/UX)

Graphic design talent for software development is readily available.

Salary Range: AU $20,000 - AU $29,000 per year  (includes all government mandated benefits).
Application and Web Development

Industry Skilled Roles

Estimators, draftsmen, architects, quntity surveyors, engineers, para legal, medical transcriptionists.

 

Administration & Finance Roles

Bookkeeping, AR/AP, doc control, invoicing, assistants, CRM admin, client surveying, time entry checking, data entry, internal reporting.

Sales & Support Roles

Quoting, ordering, procurement, inbound sales, social media activities, database cleaning / creation, CRM, outbound email lead generation.
Other Support Roles

Recruiting for You

Highly skilled IT talent looking for a better home. 

To get the best people, you NEED to pay great salaries.  It’s true in Australia and New Zealand, and it’s true here in the Philippines.

Remember, with our model we make no margin on salaries.  We are only motivated to find you the best people and to help you build a LOYAL team.

You also NEED expert recruitment resources working with you that understand the skillsets you require and know how to TEST for those skills.

Tech Elite recruit only the best IT talent on your behalf to help support your technology business or technology department.  Below you will find typical examples of job roles and their associated salary ranges for individuals in the top 2% of IT staff in the Philippines.

Technical Roles

Technical jobs require specific technical knowledge about hardware and / or software.

Client Facing Roles

Client support jobs typically suit friendly, sociable people with excellent communication skills. For this reason, interviews for this type of position normally include a range of behavioral questions.

Software Development Roles

Offshore software development teams are usually only effective in specific circumstances.  Splitting a development team between onshore and offshore locations creates unique challenges that must not be ignored. Finding skilled people is not the problem.  Getting alignment in the team and output which is continually consistent with the your expectations are where the challenge lies.

Many staffing providers are just interesting in selling you “bums on seats”.  They will either not understand your challenges as a developer or will not give you advice on how to structure your team to be successful.  They may not even tell you when they think a certain arrangement just will not work.  So please chat to us about your intentions and we will provide you with valuable advice and guidance in respect to your plans.  It is also worth noting that managing and growing an in-house software product is MUCH easier than building a development team to work on new projects.

Before looking to build a development team with us, we strongly recommend that you have a strong project manager in your local office who is available to spend time with your offshore team on a daily basis.  Your offshore team can be managed via video conferencing, however we also recommend regular visits by your onshore project manager to your offshore team in the Philippines (or at minimum have your senior offshore team members visit you in your local office).  It’s also very important to have a strong senior developer / team leader to head up your Philippines-based team – this role is crucial and you MUST get the right person to give your offshore team the best chance of success.
